workflow.name: Create a daily visual journal from Discord chats with GPT-4, DALL-E and Notion
workflow.description:
I wanted a journal but never had the discipline to write one. Most of my day happens in Discord anyway, so I built this to do it for me.

Every night, it reads my Discord channel, asks GPT-4 to write a short reflection, generates an image that captures the vibe of the day, and saves everything to Notion. I wake up with a diary entry I didn't have to write.

**How it works**
1. Runs daily at whatever time you set
2. Grabs messages from a Discord channel (last 100)
3. Filters to today's messages only
4. GPT-4 writes a title, summary, mood, and tags
5. DALL-E generates an image based on the day's themes
6. Uploads image to Cloudinary (Notion needs a public URL)
7. Creates a Notion page with everything formatted nicely

**Setup**
- Discord Bot credentials (read message history permission)
- OpenAI API key
- Free Cloudinary account for image hosting
- Notion integration connected to your database

**Notion database properties needed**
- Title (title)
- Date (date)
- Summary (text)
- Mood (select): üòä Great, üòå Good, üòê Neutral, üòî Low, üî• Productive
- Message Count (number)

Takes about 15 minutes to set up. I use Gallery view in Notion with the AI image as cover - looks pretty cool after a few weeks.

parameters.content:
##  Visual Daily Journal

**Automatic diary entries from your Discord conversations**

Every day at your chosen time, this workflow:
1. Fetches messages from a Discord channel
2. Summarizes your day with GPT-4
3. Generates a representative image with DALL-E
4. Creates a beautiful entry in Notion

---

### How it works

1. **Schedule Trigger** runs daily at your chosen time (default: 11pm)
2. **Discord node** fetches the last 100 messages from your channel
3. **Filter node** keeps only today's messages
4. **Check node** skips if no messages found
5. **GPT-4** analyzes conversations and creates:
   - Creative title
   - Reflective summary
   - Mood assessment
   - Relevant tags
   - Image prompt
6. **DALL-E 3** generates an artistic image for the day
7. **Cloudinary** uploads the image (Notion needs a public URL)
8. **Notion** creates a beautiful diary entry with everything

---

### Setup steps (15-20 min)

1. **Discord credentials**
   - Go to discord.com/developers/applications
   - Create New Application ‚Üí Bot ‚Üí Copy Token
   - Add bot to server with Read Message History permission
   - In n8n: Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí Discord Bot API

2. **OpenAI credentials**
   - Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí OpenAI API

3. **Cloudinary** (free account)
   - Sign up at cloudinary.com
   - Copy Cloud Name, API Key, API Secret
   - Update values in "Upload to Cloudinary" node

4. **Notion credentials**
   - Create integration at notion.so/my-integrations
   - Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí Notion API
   - Share your database with the integration

5. **Configure nodes**
   - Select your Discord server and channel
   - Update OPENAI_API_KEY in DALL-E node
   - Set your Notion database ID

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
